name: analogue
content:
analogue adjective
(RECORDED SIGNALS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
An analogue recording is one that is made by changing the sound waves into electrical signals of the same type. An analogue signal is a signal of this type: I started recording the sounds on analogue reel-to-reel tape. This is the standard method used to convert analogue signals to digital.
Analogue television is broadcast using analogue signals, rather than using digital signals: Grants can be given to people who still watch analogue broadcasts on old television sets to help them cover the cost of a digital converter.
An analogue camera or analogue photography records images on film, rather than in a form that can be looked at on a computer: Many manufacturers are discontinuing their lines of analogue cameras. If your camera is analogue, you'll need to install a video-capture device that will convert the analogue signal from your camera into digital code. Analogue photography appears to be back in fashion right now. Compare
digital
More examplesFewer examplesA vinyl record is analogue. A CD is digital, which means that the sound, which starts as analogue, has to be digitally coded.The album was recorded in Paris on analogue equipment.That year the vast majority of television being watched was still on analogue terrestrial channels.The 2,000 households in the area which are still watching analogue have less than four weeks to convert to digital.There's been a real transition from the old analogue security cameras.We are upgrading the existing CCTV cameras from analogue to digital.

analogue adjective
(CLOCK)
An analogue clock or watch shows the time using numbers around the edge and hands that point to the numbers: You can choose to have the time display as an analogue or digital clock. She still uses an old-fashioned analogue alarm clock. Opposite
digital
More examplesFewer examplesAn analogue watch user will just glance at the timepiece and say, "It's about quarter to five." The children are asked to draw a picture of an analogue clock showing a particular time.
